numlitem.para: Inoperative components are properly secured by an accepted procedure, and
Aircraft is dispatched in accordance with appropriate AOM Landing Gear Extended Appendix.
Comply with procedures outlined in the appropriate AOM Landing Gear Extended Appendix in the AOM.
Use Landing Gear Extended Flight Planning Data.
Complete T/O runway limit and T/O climb worksheets in AOM chapter 5.8.
Flaps 5 or 15 only takeoff operation authorized.
Extended overwater flights at a horizontal distance of more than 50NM from the nearest shoreline are prohibited.
Vmo/Mmo is reduced to 270 KIAS/0.73 Mach.
If "OCA" is present on Airport Analytical page and is greater than level off height, contact Aircraft Performance Engineering for alternate Airport Analysis Data.

placard.para: Placard near Gear Handle "GEAR RETRACTING INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

warning.para: MAKE SURE THAT THE MAIN GEAR DOORS CAN NOT OPEN INTO PERSONS OR EQUIPMENT. THE DOORS OPEN QUICKLY AND CAN CAUSE INJURY OR DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: Install the landing gear downlock pins in the main and nose gear. Remove Red Flags from Pins. Secure pins with safety wire. Alternate procedure use, nuts and bolts in place of gear pins.
Open and collar the Landing Gear Lever Lock circuit breakers (11S20) prior to flight to prevent inadvertent gear lever movement to the up position.

Select the ALTN position (switch pushed up) on the ALTERNATE Vmo/Mmo switch S10471 on the EE Bay Service Panel. This provides gear down Vmo/Mmo data for display on airspeed indicators and causes the aural warning siren, red WARNING master warning lights on the glareshield, and the red OVSPD warning light on the Captain's panel to come on, and OVERSPEED warning on EICAS to appear when the gear down Vmo/Mmo is exceeded.
